FuncDef:
The mld snooping ip-source-policy command configures a filtering policy to permit or deny MLD Report messages of hosts in a VLAN, controlling the multicast groups that the hosts can join.
The undo mld snooping ip-source-policy command restores the default configuration. The mld snooping ip-source-policy command configures a filtering policy to permit or deny MLD Report messages of hosts in a VLAN, controlling the multicast groups that the hosts can join. The undo mld snooping ip-source-policy command restores the default configuration. By default, no filtering policy is configured, so that all hosts in a VLAN can join multicast groups. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an ACL6 number.
The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 3999. The ACL6 is used to permit or deny services requests of hosts in a VLAN based on source or destination addresses carried in MLD Report messages.

Specifies the name of a named ACL6.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The name must start with a letter or digit, and cannot contain only digits.
